faqs.mainText: JSON stands for JavaScript Object Notation. It is a lightweight data-interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate.
JSON is used widely across the internet for almost every single API that you will access, as well as for config files and things such as games and text editors.

faqs.headerText: How to use JSON in JavaScript?
faqs.mainText: JSON is often used when data is sent from a server to a web page. It can be easily converted into JavaScript objects using the JSON.parse() method.
